[[Image:Stephenson.jpg|thumb|William Stephenson]] '''Q Methodology''' is a research method used in [[psychology]] and other [[social sciences]] to study people's "subjectivity" -- that is, their viewpoint. Q was developed by psychologist [[William Stephenson (psychologist)|William Stephenson]]. It has been used both in clinical settings for assessing patients, as well as in research settings to examine how people think about a topic.
+
'''Q Methodology''' is a research method used in [[psychology]] and other [[social sciences]] to study people's "subjectivity" -- that is, their viewpoint. Q was developed by psychologist [[William Stephenson (psychologist)|William Stephenson]]. It has been used both in clinical settings for assessing patients, as well as in research settings to examine how people think about a topic.
==Technical overview ==
